conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: walls have clear height and thickness, multiple faces are visible per wall, and the camera is angled with the ceiling removed to expose interior volume.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with clean corners and readable room volumes; minor simplification of some wall-edge/trim details but overall correct isometric cutaway presentation.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall layout matches: open kitchen/living at left, bedroom at upper area, bath core near center-right, stair zone at far right. Some proportional/partition placement appears slightly adjusted (bath/closet core and corridor widths), and door positions/leaf swings from the 2D plan are not explicitly represented.

interior_elements.notes: Major elements included and placed plausibly: kitchen counters + island, bed in bedroom, dining table, living seating, bathroom fixtures. Slight simplification and not all 2D-indicated furnishings are mirrored exactly.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean render with distinct walls/floors and good visibility. Openings are readable, but lack of explicit door geometry and fairly uniform materials reduce clarity of some architectural details.

detected_errors.description: Doors from the 2D plan (including swing directions) are not clearly modeled; openings are present but door placement/details are simplified.
Slight layout/proportion drift in the central partition core (bath/closet/hall zone) compared with the 2D plan; not a missing-room issue but internal wall placements appear adjusted.
Uniform materials and minimal detailing reduce the ability to verify some fine-grain architectural features (trim, exact opening sizes).

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion with strong overall layout fidelity, with minor-to-moderate simplifications in internal partitions and door/opening detailing.
